alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an alkyl chain attached to the sulfur of a sulfonic acid group (or a derivative thereof), where all hydrogens of the alkyl chain are replaced by fluorine atoms.
alternative_parents.name: Perfluoroalkyl sulfonic acid and derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing an oxane (tetrahydropyran) ring, which is a six-member saturated aliphatic heterocycle with one oxygen atom and five carbon atoms.
alternative_parents.name: Oxanes

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing the sulfonyl group, with the general structure RS(=O)2R' ( R,R' must not be H).
alternative_parents.name: Sulfonyls

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing the sulfonic acid group, which has the general structure RS(=O)2OH (R is not a hydrogen atom).
alternative_parents.name: Organosulfonic acids

alternative_parents.description: Organic acids containing an alkane chain linked to a sulfonic acid group. They have the general structure RS(=O)2-OH (R = alkyl).
alternative_parents.name: Alkanesulfonic acids

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a secondary alcohol functional group, with the general structure HOC(R)(R') (R,R'=alkyl, aryl).
alternative_parents.name: Secondary alcohols

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing more than one hydroxyl groups.
alternative_parents.name: Polyols

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an heterocycle with at least one oxygen atom linked to a ring carbon.
alternative_parents.name: Oxacyclic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Compounds having the structure R2C(OR')2 ( R' not Hydrogen) and thus diethers of geminal diols. Originally, the term was confined to derivatives of aldehydes (one R = H), but it now applies equally to derivatives of ketones (neither R = H ). Mixed acetals have different R' groups.
alternative_parents.name: Acetals

alternative_parents.description: Compounds comprising the primary alcohol functional group, with the general structure RCOH (R=alkyl, aryl).
alternative_parents.name: Primary alcohols

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a chemical bond between a carbon atom and a fluorine atom.
alternative_parents.name: Organofluorides

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an oxide group.
alternative_parents.name: Organic oxides

alternative_parents.description: Derivatives of hydrocarbons obtained by substituting one or more carbon atoms by an heteroatom. They contain at least one carbon atom and heteroatom.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrocarbon derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds that have a negative electric charge.
alternative_parents.name: Organic anions

class.description: Organic compounds containing a bond between a carbon atom and an oxygen atom.
class.name: Organooxygen compounds

description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as oligosaccharides. These are carbohydrates made up of 3 to 10 monosaccharide units linked to each other through glycosidic bonds.

direct_parent.description: Carbohydrates made up of 3 to 10 monosaccharide units linked to each other through glycosidic bonds.
direct_parent.name: Oligosaccharides

kingdom.description: Compounds that contain at least one carbon atom, excluding isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, Carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Organic compounds

subclass.description: Monosaccharides, disaccharides, oligosaccharides, polysaccharides, and their derivatives.
subclass.name: Carbohydrates and carbohydrate conjugates

superclass.description: Organic compounds that contain one or more oxygen atoms.
superclass.name: Organic oxygen compounds
